business.headline: Sensex closes 645 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; IndusInd Bank gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 644.64 points to end at 80,951.99, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203.75 points to close at 24,609.70.

Borana Weaves IPO booked over 100 times: Check latest subscription, GMPAllotment for the Borana Weaves IPO is expected to be finalised on Friday, May 23, 2025. The company is likely to list its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday, May 27, 2025.
Reliance to start solar module factory this year: ReportThis year, Reliance Industries will launch its solar module factory, aiming to meet India's clean energy goals by producing 20 GW annually.

World's happiest and unhappiest careers revealed. Is your job among them?Researchers at the University of Tartu in Estonia looked at 263 different jobs and asked over 59,000 people about their work and life satisfaction. They also used health data from the Estonian Biobank to get a better picture of what really makes people happy in their jobs.

Covid cases surge in India: Will it trigger a stock market crash?Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex had dropped by over 900 points to 80,681.76, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 266 points at 24,547.45 as of 12:45 pm. The fall in the market comes after days of strong performance.

Walmart to cut 1,500 jobs in restructuring move: ReportThe job cuts will affect several areas, including Walmart's global tech team, the e-commerce section in US stores, and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.

EPFO adds 14.58 lakh members in March. Women and youth lead the wayMost of the new members who joined EPFO for the first time in March were youngsters. Around 4.45 lakh people in the 18–25 age group signed up in March, making up nearly 59% of all new subscribers. Many in this age group are first-time jobseekers.

Tata Teleservices shares jumps 11% today. What's driving the rally?The trigger behind the rally appears to be growing speculation around a potential capital infusion by Tata Sons Ltd into its struggling telecom subsidiary, Tata Teleservices Ltd (TTSL).

ABFRL demerger: Brokerages assign fair value to new fashion twins. Details hereBrokerages have begun breaking down the newly split entities, laying out distinct growth paths and fair value estimates for both ABFRL and ABLBL.

All ITR forms are out, but you still can't file. What's causing the delay?While all seven ITR forms (ITR-1 to ITR-7) and even the updated ITR-U form are ready, the filing process can't begin until the government activates the utility software. These utilities are essential tools that help taxpayers fill in, check, and submit their returns online or offline.

ABFRL stock drops 66% post demerger. What investors should know The sharp decline from Wednesday's close of Rs 268.95 reflects the market's adjustment for the value of the demerged entity, not a deterioration in Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd's fundamentals.

Who is Vaibhav Taneja? Tesla CFO who made more than Pichai and NadellaWhile Sundar Pichai took home $10.73 million and Satya Nadella received $79.1 million in 2024, Taneja's total earnings far exceeded both.

entertainment.headline: 2025 American Music Awards: Jennifer Lopez to host, Janet Jackson to receive icon awardThe 2025 AMAs will air live from Las Vegas on May 26, featuring performances by Jennifer Lopez, Janet Jackson, and more. Kendrick Lamar leads nominations. Tributes to US veterans included.

Scarlett Johansson shines at Cannes with grief-themed film 'Eleanor the Great'Scarlett Johansson made her directorial debut at Cannes with Eleanor the Great, a touching film on grief and identity, starring June Squibb, earning acclaim and a standing ovation at the premiere.

Kid Cudi testifies Diddy broke into his home, car set on fire weeks laterKid Cudi testified that Sean "Diddy" Combs broke into his home after learning of his relationship with Cassie. Weeks later, Cudi's car was set on fire with a Molotov cocktail inside.

K-Pop stars turn Demon slayers in Netflix's new animated filmNetflix's KPop Demon Hunters anime follows three K-pop idols who secretly battle demons. With music, magic, and mystery, the film releases globally on June 20, promising action-packed supernatural fun.

Kamal Haasan on dealing with release day pressure: With age, we learn to take blameActor Kamal Haasan, during the promotions of his upcoming film Thug Life, reflected on handling release-day pressure and the importance of staying humble and grounded.

Rajkummar Rao joins filmmaker Soojit Sircar in a two-hero comedy film: ReportRajkummar Rao has reportedly teamed up with director Shoojit Sircar for an upcoming two-hero satirical comedy. Filming is set to begin in late 2025, with the search for the second lead currently underway.

Prateik Smita Patil on dropping his surname: I didn't want to belong to themActor Prateik Smita Patil recently opened up about the custody battle between his late mother's family and father Raj Babbar. He also reflected on how he initially felt bitter about his parents.

Jewellery brand ropes in Shah Rukh Khan to target Gen Z, millennialsActor Shah Rukh Khan has been roped in by lifestyle jewellery brand Candere as its ambassador. Shah Rukh expressed his admiration for jewellery as symbolic of love, memories and identity.

Kajol seeks blessings at Kolkata's Dakshineswar Kali temple ahead of her film MaaAfter seeking blessings at the Dakshineswar Kali Temple in Kolkata, Kajol called her role in 'Maa' her strongest ever. Directed by Vishal Furia, the film will follow her powerful journey as a mother fiercely protecting her daughter.

Exclusive: Music artist KSHMR explains how he makes money from royalty-free musicAmerican musician KSHMR explains how he earns from royalty-free music samples used globally, including by popular K-pop groups. He also shared how he incorporates his Indian roots into his music.

Sunny Deol to make his OTT debut with director Sidharth P Malhotra: ReportSunny Deol is set to make his Netflix debut with an action thriller directed by Siddharth P Malhotra, adapted from the 2007 film 'Death Sentence'. The project, written by Suparn Verma, begins filming in July 2025 and marks a major addition to Deol's packed slate of upcoming releases.

Silambarasan on playing a feminine role in STR 50: Took notes from Kamal HaasanActor Silambarasan confirms playing a character with feminine traits in his upcoming film, STR 50. He revealed that he discussed the role with Kamal Haasan to understand the nuances better.

Suniel Shetty reacts to backlash over normal delivery remark: Comment was twistedSuniel Shetty addressed backlash over his comments on daughter Athiya's natural delivery, clarifying his remarks were taken out of context. He issued a sincere apology to women, emphasising respect for all birthing choices.

Pankaj Tripathi debunks rumours of replacing Paresh Rawal in Hera Pheri 3Actor Pankaj Tripathi recently reacted to the ongoing fans' appeal about replacing Paresh Rawal in 'Hera Pheri 3.' The actor reasoned why he was not the right choice to play Baburao Ganpatrao Apte.

Explained: Tamannaah's Mysore Sandal deal and non-Kannadiga ambassador backlashActor Tamannaah was signed on as the brand ambassador of Mysore Sandal Soap, which did not go down well with a section of people on the Internet. Many questioned the Karnataka government's decision to appoint a Bollywood actor for the brand over Kannada actors.

My goddess: Janhvi Kapoor's wet saree look wins boyfriend Shikhar's heartActor Janhvi Kapoor's boyfriend, Shikhar Pahariya, was all smitten by her looks in a white outfit at Cannes. His reply under the actor's pictures is sure to melt your heart.

Salman Khan invited me, know him for 6 months: Woman who trespassed into his homeOn the early morning of May 21, 36-year-old Isha Chabria trespassed into Galaxy Apartments in Mumbai, where actor Salman Khan lives with his family. She has now claimed that she has known the superstar for six months and was invited into his home.

Salman Khan to not replace Big B as KBC 17 host: SourceSalman Khan will not replace Amitabh Bachchan as 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17' host. A source close to the development told India Today that such reports are not true.

Deepika Padukone, Mrunal Thakur and Janhvi Kapoor in Allu Arjun's AA22: ReportAllu Arjun and Atlee's upcoming futuristic action entertainer might feature Deepika Padukone, Mrunal Thakur, and Janhvi Kapoor as the female leads. The film was announced earlier this year.

general news.headline: Trump pauses Harvard University's ability to enroll international studentsThe Trump admin has revoked Harvard's certification to enrol international students, accusing it of promoting antisemitism and ties to China. Harvard called the move unlawful and vowed to keep supporting students from over 140 countries.

Pak rejected IndiGo pilot's request to use airspace to avoid turbulenceOn Wednesday, an IndiGo flight carrying 227 passengers from Delhi to Srinagar was caught in terrifying mid-air turbulence, sending those onboard into a panic and causing visible damage to the aircraft's nose.

Yunus threatens to resign, protests might rock Dhaka yet againMuhammad Yunus, the head of the interim government in Bangladesh, threatened to resign if all the parties didn't offer him their full support. This came a day after Army Chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman called for elections to be held by December and the BNP sought a road map for polls. Yunus' resignation buzz is being seen as a ploy to launch a fresh agitation in Dhaka.

Exclusive: Nirav Modi denied bail for tenth time - What UK court saidThe court rejected the bail plea of Nirav Modi for the tenth time. He is the prime accused in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank (PNB) fraud case.

Sanskrit shlok, Banarasi cape: Aishwarya Rai's Cannes outfit celebrates IndiaAishwarya Rai Bachchan made a strong fashion statement at Cannes 2025 as she walked the red carpet in a Gaurav Gupta creation - a black gown with a silver Banarasi brocade cape.

Met all conditions: IMF justifies $1 billion bailout to debt-ridden PakistanThe IMF said Pakistan met all targets for its $1 billion loan, part of a $7 billion programme. "Funds go to central bank's reserves," clarified the IMF, adding that any policy deviation could impact future reviews.

San Diego plane crash: 2 dead, dozens displaced after jet hits military housingA private jet crashed into San Diego's military housing during heavy fog, killing two, injuring several, and destroying cars and homes. Over 100 residents were displaced as fires spread rapidly.

China to expand satellite support for Pakistan Army, talks held last weekChinese and Pakistani military officials met on May 16 to enhance satellite and 5G support for the Pakistan Army after its defeat in a four-day conflict with India.

Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem responds to Neeraj Chopra's 'not close friends' commentPakistan's Arshad Nadeem was asked for his thoughts on Neeraj Chopra's recent comments about their camaraderie. The Olympic champion also reiterated that his ultimate goal is to breach the 100-metre mark in men's javelin.

Delhi University objects to Rahul Gandhi's 'unannounced' campus visitDelhi University, objecting to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's unannounced visit to the campus, said that it would take strict actions.

No bloody corridor: Bangladesh Army chief's warning makes Yunus govt blinkThe Muhammad Yunus-led interim government has blinked on the controversial Rakhine corridor plan after Bangladesh Army chief Waker-Uz-Zaman issued a stern warning, referring to it as the "bloody corridor". Yunus is believed to have agreed to the Rakhine corridor, seen as a threat to Bangladesh's sovereignty, to cling on to power with the help of the US.

Japan man accused of raping 50 women, 3,000 videos, images foundA former taxi driver in Japan has been arrested for allegedly drugging and raping a woman, with media reports linking him to around 50 similar assaults since 2008.
Explainer: What caused IndiGo flight's massive air turbulence?An IndiGo flight from Delhi to Srinagar was caught in terrifying mid-air turbulence on Wednesday. Experts explain the reason behind it.

Imran Khan slams General Asim Munir, says Pakistan ruled by jungle lawFormer Pakistan PM Imran Khan slammed General Asim Munir's promotion to Field Marshal, calling Pakistan a "jungle law" regime, and condemned the government's suppression of justice and democracy.

GT vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh masterclass hurts Gujarat Titans' top two hopesIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh's maiden IPL century and a collective effort from the bowling group helped Lucknow Super Giants complete a double over Gujarat Titans. Shubman Gill's men are on top of the points table, but they might miss out on a spot in the top two.

Banu Mushtaq dedicates Booker to country, celebrates win as part of activismBanu Mushtaq, the first Kannada writer to win the International Booker Prize, has dedicated the award to the people of India. She said that she is celebrating the win as part of her activism for marginalised communities.

Indian-origin techie gatecrashes Microsoft event over Gaza, yet againIndian-origin techie Vaniya Agarwal, who disrupted a major Microsoft event in April and was subsequently fired, once again interrupted the tech giant's Build 2025 conference in Seattle, Washington. She alleged that Microsoft was complicit in Israel's military campaign in Gaza. Agarwal, along with another former employee, confronted Neta Haiby, the company's Head of AI Security, over Microsoft's agreements with Israel.
Why it's rain pain for Bengaluru againWith the city deluged by torrential rains again, a look at how the problem has been compounded over the years by multiple agencies working in silos

On Turkey, India highlights need for 'sensitivities to each other's concerns'Referring to the outrage against Turkey over its support for Pakistan post the Pahalgam attack, EAM spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said that both nations should have a sensitive approach towards matters concerning each other.
Muslim family offers venue after rain disrupts Hindu wedding in PuneHeavy rain disrupted a Hindu wedding in Pune, prompting a nearby Muslim family to offer their reception hall for the ceremony.

Scarlett Johansson shines at Cannes with grief-themed film 'Eleanor the Great'Scarlett Johansson made her directorial debut at Cannes with Eleanor the Great, a touching film on grief and identity, starring June Squibb, earning acclaim and a standing ovation at the premiere.

Only Test: Top 3 script world record as England post 498 on Day 1 vs ZimbabweEngland vs Zimbabwe, Only Test: Zak Crawley, Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope hit a hundred each as England posted 498 runs for 3 on Day 1 in Nottingham. Joe Root, meanwhile, completed 13,000 runs in Test cricket, achieving the major landmark on Thursday.

Indore rifle shooting coach arrested for molesting girl under guise of practiceIndore Police arrested shooting coach Mohsin Khan for allegedly molesting girl trainees at a local academy under the guise of practice. The accused also reportedly recorded videos and trapped multiple women.

Trump's big tax bill has passed the House. Here's what's inside itHouse Republicans passed a sweeping Trump-backed bill featuring permanent tax cuts, food aid work requirements, SALT cap increases, and spending reductions, with additional revisions expected when the package reaches the Senate.

sports.headline: RCB captain Rajat Patidar fit for SRH game: Andy FlowerRajat Patidar has recovered from his finger injury and is ready to play against SunRisers Hyderabad, confirmed head coach Andy Flower. The team remains confident despite a long break and a change of venue for the match.

Rishabh Pant wants LSG to learn and move forward from disappointing IPL 2025Lucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant has called on his side to reflect on the lessons from a disappointing IPL campaign, after a consolation victory over Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad brought their season to a close.

Only Test: Top 3 script world record as England post 498 on Day 1 vs ZimbabweEngland vs Zimbabwe, Only Test: Zak Crawley, Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope hit a hundred each as England posted 498 runs for 3 on Day 1 in Nottingham. Joe Root, meanwhile, completed 13,000 runs in Test cricket, achieving the major landmark on Thursday.

GT vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh masterclass hurts Gujarat Titans' top two hopesIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh's maiden IPL century and a collective effort from the bowling group helped Lucknow Super Giants complete a double over Gujarat Titans. Shubman Gill's men are on top of the points table, but they might miss out on a spot in the top two.

Arshad in 1st innings, Akash in 2nd: Pacers take nasty hits in GT vs LSGFast bowlers faced multiple injuries during the Gujarat Titans and Lucknow Super Giants match at Narendra Modi Stadium. The incidents affected bowling performances and led to crucial moments in the game.

Watch: Akash Singh goes full proxy for Digvesh Rathi, nails notebook celebrationIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Left-arm pacer Akash Singh celebrated Jos Buttler's wicket by imitating Digvesh Rathi's popular notebook celebration in Ahmedabad on Thursday. Digvesh missed the game due to a one-match suspension.

Joe Root becomes slowest batter to score 13,000 runs in Test cricketEngland star Joe Root became the first Englishman—and the fifth batter overall after Sachin Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, Ricky Ponting, and Jacques Kallis—to score 13,000 runs in Test cricket.

Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi gets hero's welcome in hometown after IPL 2025 successIPL 2025: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi was given a hero's welcome in his hometown on Thursday, May 22. The Rajasthan Royals batter shone in his maiden season in the Indian Premier League.

Rishabh Pant still got it: Fans praise LSG skipper's no-look six vs GT's RabadaIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Rishabh Pant offered a late reminder of his explosive talent, smashing 16 off just six balls in the final over against Gujarat Titans, including two sixes off Kagiso Rabada.

Mitchell Marsh hits maiden IPL hundred, first overseas centurion in 2025 seasonIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh became the first overseas batter to hit a century in the 2025 season. The Australian big-hitter smashed eight sixes for his 64-ball 117 in Ahmedabad on Thursday, May 22.

Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem responds to Neeraj Chopra's 'not close friends' commentPakistan's Arshad Nadeem was asked for his thoughts on Neeraj Chopra's recent comments about their camaraderie. The Olympic champion also reiterated that his ultimate goal is to breach the 100-metre mark in men's javelin.

Joe Root becomes slowest batter to score 13,000 runs in Test cricketEngland star Joe Root became the first Englishman—and the fifth batter overall after Sachin Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, Ricky Ponting, and Jacques Kallis—to score 13,000 runs in Test cricket.

Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi gets hero's welcome in hometown after IPL 2025 successIPL 2025: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi was given a hero's welcome in his hometown on Thursday, May 22. The Rajasthan Royals batter shone in his maiden season in the Indian Premier League.

Rishabh Pant still got it: Fans praise LSG skipper's no-look six vs GT's RabadaIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Rishabh Pant offered a late reminder of his explosive talent, smashing 16 off just six balls in the final over against Gujarat Titans, including two sixes off Kagiso Rabada.

Mitchell Marsh hits maiden IPL hundred, first overseas centurion in 2025 seasonIPL 2025, GT vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh became the first overseas batter to hit a century in the 2025 season. The Australian big-hitter smashed eight sixes for his 64-ball 117 in Ahmedabad on Thursday, May 22.

Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem responds to Neeraj Chopra's 'not close friends' commentPakistan's Arshad Nadeem was asked for his thoughts on Neeraj Chopra's recent comments about their camaraderie. The Olympic champion also reiterated that his ultimate goal is to breach the 100-metre mark in men's javelin.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
